Description: Cube-shaped wooden canopic-chest of Satipi with a flat lid. Al made from joined wooden boards, covered by a thin layer of white plaster and painted yellow. Over this are bands of hieroglyphic text at the corners, with remains of two crossing texts on the lid. The hieroglyphs are painted green and the texts invoke deities on behalf of Satipi, including the Four Sons of Horus, Isis, Nephthys, Geb and Selkis. Some areas of surface lost.
Condition: poor; weak structure; some plaster missing
Associated names: Named in inscription: Sons of Horus
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
